unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Delectable Journeys: Finding Mean and Standard Deviation
question_text:
Delectable Journeys is a small but growing company that offers different types of guided food tours in various U. S. cities. At the end of each tour, participants are asked to rate their experience on a scale of $1$ to $5$ with $5$ being the best rating possible. The table below shows the distribution of customer ratings.
What is the mean and standard deviation of the customer ratings?
What is the mean and standard deviation of the customer ratings?
solution:
The rating that a customer will give is a random variable that we will call $X$.

The formula for calculating the mean of a random variable is:

μX=∑(xi)(pi)=(x1)(p1)+(x2)(p2)+......+(xn)(pn)

We can substitute our values in the formula:

μX=(1)(0.04)+(2)(0.11)+(3)(0.21)+(4)(0.28)+(5)(0.36)=3.81
